title: 111_s1138
content:
The Act titled "Bay Area Regional Water Recycling Program Expansion Act of 2009" authorizes the CCCSD-Concord Recycled Water Project under the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act. The Act authorizes the CCCSD-Concord Recycled Water Project for the design, planning, and construction of recycled water distribution systems in cooperation with the Central Contra Costa Sanitary District, California. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25 percent, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $1,800,000 is authorized for appropriations. ``SEC. 1650. CENTRAL DUBLIN RECYCLED WATER DISTRIBUTION AND RETROFIT PROJECT. Authorization for the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with Dublin San Ramon Services District, California. Federal share limited to 25% of total project cost. No funds provided for operation and maintenance. $1,150,000 authorized for appropriations.

SEC. 1651. PETALUMA RECYCLED WATER PROJECT, PHASES 2A, 2B, AND 3.`` "Authorization for the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in Petaluma, California. Federal share limited to 25% of total project cost. No funds provided for operation and maintenance. $6,000,000 authorized for appropriations. Central Redwood City Recycled Water Project also authorized." "Authorization for the Central Redwood City Recycled Water Project with a federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds for project operation and maintenance. $8,000,000 authorized for appropriations. Palo Alto Recycled Water Pipeline Project also authorized." "Authorization for the Palo Alto Recycled Water Pipeline Project with a federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds provided for project operation and maintenance. $8,250,000 authorized for appropriations. Ironhouse Sanitary District (ISD) Antioch Recycled Water Project also authorized." The Secretary, in cooperation with the Ironhouse Sanitary District (ISD), California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water distribution systems. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $7,000,000 is authorized for appropriations. The Secretary will enter agreements with San Francisco Bay Area Regional Water Recycling agencies to fund projects through BACWA. The agreements will include provisions for construction cost reimbursement. Clerical amendments are made to the table of contents of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992. The Secretary will enter agreements with San Francisco Bay Area Regional Water Recycling agencies to fund projects through BACWA, including the CCCSD-Concord, Central Dublin, Petaluma phases 2a, 2b, and 3, Central Redwood City, Palo Alto, and Ironhouse Sanitary District (ISD) Antioch recycled water projects. Amendments are made to the table of contents of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992. Modification to authorized projects includes increasing funding for the Antioch Recycled Water Project to $3,125,000 and for the South Bay Advanced Recycled Water Treatment Facility to $13,250,000.
